00061 //== CLASS DEFINITION =========================================================
00062 
00081 // TODO: it might be possible to define Property using kind of a runtime info
00082 // structure holding the size of T. Then reserve, swap, resize, etc can be written
00083 // in pure malloc() style w/o virtual overhead. Template member function proved per
00084 // element access to the properties, asserting dynamic_casts in debug
00085 
00086 template <class T>
00087 class PropertyT : public BaseProperty
00088 {
00089 public:
00090 
00091   typedef T                                       Value;
00092   typedef std::vector<T>                          vector_type;
00093   typedef T                                       value_type;
00094   typedef typename vector_type::reference         reference;
00095   typedef typename vector_type::const_reference   const_reference;
00096 
00097 public:
00098 
00100   PropertyT(const std::string& _name = "<unknown>")
00101   : BaseProperty(_name)
00102   {}
00103 
00105   PropertyT(const PropertyT & _rhs)
00106       : BaseProperty( _rhs ), data_( _rhs.data_ ) {}
00107 
00108 public: // inherited from BaseProperty
00109 
00110   virtual void reserve(size_t _n) { data_.reserve(_n);    }
00111   virtual void resize(size_t _n)  { data_.resize(_n);     }
00112   virtual void push_back()        { data_.push_back(T()); }
00113   virtual void swap(size_t _i0, size_t _i1)
00114   { std::swap(data_[_i0], data_[_i1]); }
00115 
00116 public:
00117 
00118   virtual void set_persistent( bool _yn )
00119   { check_and_set_persistent<T>( _yn ); }
00120 
00121   virtual size_t       n_elements()   const { return data_.size(); }
00122   virtual size_t       element_size() const { return IO::size_of<T>(); }
00123 
00124 #ifndef DOXY_IGNORE_THIS
00125   struct plus {
00126     size_t operator () ( size_t _b, const T& _v )
00127     { return _b + IO::size_of<T>(_v); }
00128   };
00129 #endif
00130 
00131   virtual size_t size_of(void) const
00132   {
00133     if (element_size() != IO::UnknownSize)
00134       return this->BaseProperty::size_of(n_elements());
00135     return std::accumulate(data_.begin(), data_.end(), 0, plus());
00136   }
00137 
00138   virtual size_t size_of(size_t _n_elem) const
00139   { return this->BaseProperty::size_of(_n_elem); }
00140 
00141   virtual size_t store( std::ostream& _ostr, bool _swap ) const
00142   {
00143     if ( IO::is_streamable<vector_type>() )
00144       return IO::store(_ostr, data_, _swap );
00145     size_t bytes = 0;
00146     for (size_t i=0; i<n_elements(); ++i)
00147       bytes += IO::store( _ostr, data_[i], _swap );
00148     return bytes;
00149   }
00150 
00151   virtual size_t restore( std::istream& _istr, bool _swap )
00152   {
00153     if ( IO::is_streamable<vector_type>() )
00154       return IO::restore(_istr, data_, _swap );
00155     size_t bytes = 0;
00156     for (size_t i=0; i<n_elements(); ++i)
00157       bytes += IO::restore( _istr, data_[i], _swap );
00158     return bytes;
00159   }
00160 
00161 public: // data access interface
00162 
00164   const T* data() const { 
00165 
00166     if( data_.empty() )
00167       return 0;
00168 
00169     return &data_[0]; 
00170   }
00171 
00173   reference operator[](int _idx)
00174   {
00175     assert( size_t(_idx) < data_.size() );
00176     return data_[_idx];
00177   }
00178 
00180   const_reference operator[](int _idx) const
00181   {
00182     assert( size_t(_idx) < data_.size());
00183     return data_[_idx];
00184   }
00185 
00187   PropertyT<T>* clone() const
00188   {
00189     PropertyT<T>* p = new PropertyT<T>( *this );
00190     return p;
00191   }
00192 
00193 
00194 private:
00195 
00196   vector_type data_;
00197 };
00198

00207 template <>
00208 class PropertyT<bool> : public BaseProperty
00209 {
00210 public:
00211 
00212   typedef std::vector<bool>                       vector_type;
00213   typedef bool                                    value_type;
00214   typedef vector_type::reference                  reference;
00215   typedef vector_type::const_reference            const_reference;
00216 
00217 public:
00218 
00219   PropertyT(const std::string& _name = "<unknown>")
00220     : BaseProperty(_name)
00221   { }
00222 
00223 public: // inherited from BaseProperty
00224 
00225   virtual void reserve(size_t _n) { data_.reserve(_n);    }
00226   virtual void resize(size_t _n)  { data_.resize(_n);     }
00227   virtual void push_back()        { data_.push_back(bool()); }
00228   virtual void swap(size_t _i0, size_t _i1)
00229   { bool t(data_[_i0]); data_[_i0]=data_[_i1]; data_[_i1]=t; }
00230 
00231 public:
00232 
00233   virtual void set_persistent( bool _yn )
00234   {
00235     check_and_set_persistent<bool>( _yn );
00236   }
00237 
00238   virtual size_t       n_elements()   const { return data_.size();  }
00239   virtual size_t       element_size() const { return UnknownSize;    }
00240   virtual size_t       size_of() const      { return size_of( n_elements() ); }
00241   virtual size_t       size_of(size_t _n_elem) const
00242   {
00243     return _n_elem / 8 + ((_n_elem % 8)!=0);
00244   }
00245 
00246   size_t store( std::ostream& _ostr, bool /* _swap */ ) const
00247   {
00248     size_t bytes = 0;
00249 
00250     size_t N = data_.size() / 8;
00251     size_t R = data_.size() % 8;
00252 
00253     size_t        idx;  // element index
00254     size_t        bidx;
00255     unsigned char bits; // bitset
00256 
00257     for (bidx=idx=0; idx < N; ++idx, bidx+=8)
00258     {
00259       bits = !!data_[bidx]
00260         | (!!data_[bidx+1] << 1)
00261         | (!!data_[bidx+2] << 2)
00262         | (!!data_[bidx+3] << 3)
00263         | (!!data_[bidx+4] << 4)
00264         | (!!data_[bidx+5] << 5)
00265         | (!!data_[bidx+6] << 6)
00266         | (!!data_[bidx+7] << 7);
00267       _ostr << bits;
00268     }
00269     bytes = N;
00270 
00271     if (R)
00272     {
00273       bits = 0;
00274       for (idx=0; idx < R; ++idx)
00275         bits |= !!data_[bidx+idx] << idx;
00276       _ostr << bits;
00277       ++bytes;
00278     }
00279 
00280     std::cout << std::endl;
00281 
00282     assert( bytes == size_of() );
00283 
00284     return bytes;
00285   }
00286 
00287   size_t restore( std::istream& _istr, bool /* _swap */ )
00288   {
00289     size_t bytes = 0;
00290 
00291     size_t N = data_.size() / 8;
00292     size_t R = data_.size() % 8;
00293 
00294     size_t        idx;  // element index
00295     size_t        bidx; //
00296     unsigned char bits; // bitset
00297 
00298     for (bidx=idx=0; idx < N; ++idx, bidx+=8)
00299     {
00300       _istr >> bits;
00301       data_[bidx+0] = !!(bits & 0x01);
00302       data_[bidx+1] = !!(bits & 0x02);
00303       data_[bidx+2] = !!(bits & 0x04);
00304       data_[bidx+3] = !!(bits & 0x08);
00305       data_[bidx+4] = !!(bits & 0x10);
00306       data_[bidx+5] = !!(bits & 0x20);
00307       data_[bidx+6] = !!(bits & 0x40);
00308       data_[bidx+7] = !!(bits & 0x80);
00309     }
00310     bytes = N;
00311 
00312     if (R)
00313     {
00314       _istr >> bits;
00315       for (idx=0; idx < R; ++idx)
00316         data_[bidx+idx] = !!(bits & (1<<idx));
00317       ++bytes;
00318     }
00319 
00320     std::cout << std::endl;
00321 
00322     return bytes;
00323   }
00324 
00325 
00326 public:
00327 
00329   reference operator[](int _idx)
00330   {
00331     assert( size_t(_idx) < data_.size() );
00332     return data_[_idx];
00333   }
00334 
00336   const_reference operator[](int _idx) const
00337   {
00338     assert( size_t(_idx) < data_.size());
00339     return data_[_idx];
00340   }
00341 
00343   PropertyT<bool>* clone() const
00344   {
00345     PropertyT<bool>* p = new PropertyT<bool>( *this );
00346     return p;
00347   }
00348 
00349 
00350 private:
00351 
00352   vector_type data_;
00353 };

00363 template <>
00364 class PropertyT<std::string> : public BaseProperty
00365 {
00366 public:
00367 
00368   typedef std::string                             Value;
00369   typedef std::vector<std::string>                vector_type;
00370   typedef std::string                             value_type;
00371   typedef vector_type::reference                  reference;
00372   typedef vector_type::const_reference            const_reference;
00373 
00374 public:
00375 
00376   PropertyT(const std::string& _name = "<unknown>")
00377     : BaseProperty(_name)
00378   { }
00379 
00380 public: // inherited from BaseProperty
00381 
00382   virtual void reserve(size_t _n) { data_.reserve(_n);    }
00383   virtual void resize(size_t _n)  { data_.resize(_n);     }
00384   virtual void push_back()        { data_.push_back(std::string()); }
00385   virtual void swap(size_t _i0, size_t _i1) {
00386     std::swap(data_[_i0], data_[_i1]);
00387   }
00388 
00389 public:
00390 
00391   virtual void set_persistent( bool _yn )
00392   { check_and_set_persistent<std::string>( _yn ); }
00393 
00394   virtual size_t       n_elements()   const { return data_.size();  }
00395   virtual size_t       element_size() const { return UnknownSize;    }
00396   virtual size_t       size_of() const
00397   { return IO::size_of( data_ ); }
00398 
00399   virtual size_t       size_of(size_t /* _n_elem */) const
00400   { return UnknownSize; }
00401 
00403   size_t store( std::ostream& _ostr, bool _swap ) const
00404   { return IO::store( _ostr, data_, _swap ); }
00405 
00406   size_t restore( std::istream& _istr, bool _swap )
00407   { return IO::restore( _istr, data_, _swap ); }
00408 
00409 public:
00410 
00411   const value_type* data() const {
00412       if( data_.empty() )
00413           return 0;
00414 
00415       return (value_type*) &data_[0];
00416   }
00417 
00419   reference operator[](int _idx) {
00420     assert( size_t(_idx) < data_.size());
00421     return ((value_type*) &data_[0])[_idx];
00422   }
00423 
00425   const_reference operator[](int _idx) const {
00426     assert( size_t(_idx) < data_.size());
00427     return ((value_type*) &data_[0])[_idx];
00428   }
00429 
00430   PropertyT<value_type>* clone() const {
00431     PropertyT<value_type>* p = new PropertyT<value_type>( *this );
00432     return p;
00433   }
00434 
00435 
00436 private:
00437 
00438   vector_type data_;
00439 
00440 };

00443 template <class T>
00444 struct BasePropHandleT : public BaseHandle
00445 {
00446   typedef T                                       Value;
00447   typedef std::vector<T>                          vector_type;
00448   typedef T                                       value_type;
00449   typedef typename vector_type::reference         reference;
00450   typedef typename vector_type::const_reference   const_reference;
00451 
00452   explicit BasePropHandleT(int _idx=-1) : BaseHandle(_idx) {}
00453 };
